com.ftdi.j2xx.interfaces

Interface I2cMaster

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FT_4222_I2c_Master

    public interface I2cMaster

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int init(int kbps)
      Initialize the FT4222H as an I2C master with the requested I2C speed.
      int read(int deviceAddress, byte[] buffer, int sizeToTransfer, int[] sizeTransferred)
      Read data from the I2C master device.
      int reset()
      Reset the I2C master device.
      int write(int deviceAddress, byte[] buffer, int sizeToTransfer, int[] sizeTransferred)
      Write data to the I2C master device.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        int init(int kbps)
        Initialize the FT4222H as an I2C master with the requested I2C speed.
        Parameters:
        kbps - The speed of I2C transmission. It ranges from 60K bps to 3400K bps. By specified speed, the initial function helps to setup bus speed with the corresponding mode.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • reset

        int reset()
        Reset the I2C master device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • read

        int read(int deviceAddress,
       byte[] buffer,
       int sizeToTransfer,
       int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the I2C master device.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • write

        int write(int deviceAddress,
        byte[] buffer,
        int sizeToTransfer,
        int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the I2C master device.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.
